title: Transactions
subject: Database Management Systems
theory:
A sequence of operations treated as a single unit. Either ALL execute or NONE execute. 
Example: Bank Transfer (Debit A, Credit B).

real_world_use_cases.description: If power fails after Debit but before Credit, money vanishes. Transactions prevent this by rolling back.

exam_notes: States: Active, Partially Committed, Committed, Failed, Aborted.
